about_the_game:
Space Atlas: The Solar System is an interactive educational app that takes you on a journey through the wonders of our universe. This app is designed to educate and inspire users of all ages by providing detailed and engaging content about the cosmos.

Multi-Chapter Education Project

Space Atlas: The Solar System is the first chapter of a multi-chapter education project. This chapter focuses on the wonders of our Solar System, including its planets, moons, and other celestial bodies. Future chapters will expand to cover Galaxies, Stars, Exoplanets, Cosmology, and more. Stay tuned for more!

Discover The Planets

Access detailed information about each planet's atmosphere, surface, and key features. Use interactive tools to learn more about what makes each planet unique, from Saturn's rings to Mars' canyons.

Play Games

Dive into engaging mini-games where you’ll pilot your spacecraft, landing on the moon and other celestial bodies. These fun and interactive challenges deepen your understanding of space missions and the complexities of landing on different terrains. Explore the cosmos and enjoy a hands-on learning adventure like never before!

Test Your Knowledge

Test your knowledge with Space Atlas: The Solar System quizzes! Challenge yourself with questions about the planets and other celestial bodies in our solar system. Compete with others and climb the leaderboards to see who knows the most about the cosmos. Engage in friendly competition and learn fascinating facts along the way.

Explore Surfaces

Fly a small drone across the diverse terrains of different planets, uncovering their unique landscapes and hidden features. This interactive experience lets you explore the surfaces of celestial bodies up close.

In Summary

  • Semi-realistic Solar System simulation using Kepler's equations

  • Explore 8 planets

  • Visit 1 dwarf planet (yes, Pluto!)

  • Discover 1 star

  • Experience 21 moons

  • Explore 9 celestial body surfaces up close

  • Undertake 4 spacecraft landing missions

  • Browse stunning photo galleries of planets

  • Learn about 33 unique planetary features

  • High-resolution textures: 4K for planets and 2K/4K for moons

  • Multiple perspective views of select planets

  • Try 4 spacecraft landing missions

  • Challenge yourself with 22 quizzes

  • Leaderboards for quizzes and landing missions

  • Beautiful ambient soundtrack by The Intangible

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: macOS 10.14+
  • Processor: i3 or M1
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 2 GB Video Memory
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: macOS 10.14+
  • Processor: i5 or M1
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 4 GB Video Memory
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 8
  • Processor: i3-4370
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 750
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: 10
  • Processor: i5-4590
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1050
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: Navigate through a detailed simulation of the solar system, where you can explore planets, moons, and other celestial bodies up close. Access detailed information, images, interactive content, quizzes and even mini-games where you can try to land a space probe.
